New Records: Germany won three of their four games at Euro 2024, as many as in their previous 12 games across major competitions (World Cups/Euros)
Key Match Events: Kai Havertz slotted a penalty past Kasper Schmeichel after Joachim Andersen was penalised for handling the ball in his own box
Jamal Musiala added a second with a superb curling strike
The match was briefly suspended due to a thunderstorm with dangerous lightning
The goal by Nico Schlotterbeck was ruled out for an infringement in the box
Post-Match Reflections: Ange Postecoglou defended Michael Oliver after a number of VAR decisions influenced Germany’s 2-0 victory over Denmark

Roy Keane said: ‘I’m always critical of defenders coming out defending with their hands behind their back, but I see it. I feel for defenders. That’s not the game we grew up loving, these types of decisions.’
Ian Wright added: ‘That as a handball will never ever sit well for me, I’m not sure why they’re going so deep into the science of it. The offside law for me has gone crazy.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: Christina Unkel, an American rules analyst and VAR expert, added insight for ITV during Euro 2024
Manuel Neuer made his 38th appearance at a major competition, the joint-most for Germany alongside Bastian Schweinsteiger
Jamal Musiala is now battling for the Golden Boot with other big names such as Harry Kane, Kylian Mbappe and Cristiano Ronaldo
